title: 50-acre brush fire prompts evacuation of Laguna Beach's Top of the World neighborhood
content: LAGUNA BEACH, Calif. (KABC) --  A wind-driven brush fire spread to 50 acres in south Orange County on Saturday afternoon, prompting the evacuation of Laguna Beach's Top of the World neighborhood amid a response from at least 130 firefighters, officials said.  The so-called Aliso Fire was burning in heavy brush in Wood Canyon, located behind Aliso Viejo's Soka University of America, an Orange County Fire Authority spokesperson tweeted at 1:46 p.m.     There were no immediate reports of injuries or structural damage.  Four helicopters and two fixed-wing aircraft were en route to the scene, according to the OCFA spokesperson.  DEVELOPING: More details will be added to this report as they become available.   (Copyright ©2018 KABC-TV. All Rights Reserved.)
